shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 3r-153v) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 3r-127r) I-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 127r-137v) I-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 137v-143r) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 143va-150vb) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (150vb-153vb)
Additiones 1-2.

dcomments.dcomment: Second half of the 18th cent. - first half of the 19th cent. (?)

txstates.txstate: Many fols. are stained with wax and water. A hole is burnt out on fol. 39. Holes are carefully amended on fols. 1, 149.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the brown leather cover (at least 6 tools were used: double line fillet, double circle, double circle and corni-form, interlaced line fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches (or holes) at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(2; s.l.: 2, stub after 2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(10/fols. 3r-12v) – II(10/fols. 13r-22v) – III(10/fols. 23r-32v) – IV(10/fols. 33r-42v) – V(8/fols. 43r-50v) – VI(10/fols. 51r-60v) – VII(10/fols. 61r-70v) – VIII(14/fols. 71r-84v) – IX(10/fols. 85r-94v) – X(10/fols. 95r-104v) – XI(10/fols. 105r-114v) – XII(10/fols. 115r-124v) – XIII(8/fols. 125r-132v) – XIV(10/fols. 133r-142v) – XV(12/fols. 143r-154v).

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data are for fol. 4r.
taunit.rl-info:
Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks (of the slit-type) are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The bottom ruled lines (2) were not used by the scribe on fol. 84v.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4, I-5: all data are for fol. 144r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Second half of the 18th cent.- first half of the 19th cent. (?)

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra (name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5); titles and numbers of the Pss. and Canticles; incipits and numbers of Songs; title of Texts I-2, I-3 and I-5; name and traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; initial word and abbreviation of refrains of Texts I-4 and I-5; elements of the punctuation signs and text dividers; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.
A few groups of lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I-1; two lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Texts I-3, I-4 and I-5.

abbreviations.abbreviation: እስ፡ for እስመ፡ ለዓለም፡ ምሕረቱ፡ (Ps. 135, fols. 116v-117r) Text I-4 ሰ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. ሠ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 143va-144ra) እ፡/እስ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 144rb-145ra) ኵ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 145rb-146rb) ና፡ for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 146vb-147va) ለ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ (fol. 148ra) ተ፡/ተፈ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fol. 149ra-va) ወበ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 149vb-150rb) Text I-5 ወ፡ ሣ፡ ይ፡ ሰ፡ for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፈለነ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት The abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. ወ፡/ወበ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 151rb-153va)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Ps. 118 is not numbered. - The following Pss. are numbered incorrectly: 38 (numbered 37), 39 (numbered 38), 137 (numbered 136), 145 (numbered 144), 150 (numbered 140+10).

additional.det: The note lists the months and an estimated length of the days, measured in ጫማ “feet”, for each of them.
The note starts with a certain Śǝlṭan or Bäʾat and ends with Wäldä Maryam.

extras.extra: - The Psalms are divided into groups of ten separated by means of a chain of red and black dots. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the end of the line: e.g., fols. 10r, 27r, 44r, 111v, 128r, 141v. - Part of the line is taken up: fols. 74v, 87r, 104r, 107r, 109r, 109v, 126v, 134r, 140v, 141r, 143r. - Part of the line is taken down: fols. 85r, 103v, 105r, 105v, 106v, 107r, 145r. - Some omissions and corrections are written interlineally or as a continuation of the preceding verse: e.g., fols. 4v, 9v, 11v, 23v, 27v, 35r, 54r, 62v, 110v. - Corrections written over erased words and passages: e.g., fols. 12r, 28r, 69v, 123v, 130v. - Erasures: e.g., fols. 25v, 35r, 53v, 77v, 130r. - Two lines are left unfilled on fol. 46r. - A female name has been erased from the supplication formula: fol. 38r. - Two notes of several lines have been erased: fol. 154ra. - Scribbles, writing exercises (also in the Ethiopic syllabary): fols. 1v, 153v, inner sides of both boards.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: A red thread is inserted in the right upper corner of fol. 111.

frames.frame: Fol. 3r (incipit of Text I-1): elaborate, uncoloured ornamental band; anthropomorphic and geometric motifs.
